results.title: An Attack on asthma
results.creator_credit: Ronald Mason and Academy Film Productions
results.brief_description: Describes the effects of asthma on the respiratory system and what is being done to find a cure and more effective techniques of treatment. The Asthma Foundation of Victoria’s role in helping the social and economic problems of asthma patients is outlined

results.title: Atoms for peace (U.S.S.R.)
results.creator_credit: D Bogolepov and Moscow Popular Science Film Studio
results.brief_description: Illustrates the peaceful use of atomic energy in the USSR and shows the first atomic power plant in the USSR. The program explains the basic processes involved in nuclear fission and the safety procedures which protect workers. Demonstrates the use of isotopes in medicine, especially in cancer treatment and also the application of atomic energy in industry: improved plastics, oil exploration, detection of flaws in casting and welded seams, use of tracers in checking the condition of blast furnaces and quality control in metal production. The research potential of atomic installations is explored.

results.title: Atoms for peace (Sweden)
results.brief_description: Shows how Sweden, though it is a small country, has become a world leader in the peaceful uses of atomic energy. Examples and advantages of nuclear power generation for the production of electricity and heat and use of radioactive isotopes for industry and medicine are presented. No other credits available.

results.title: Atomisation
results.creator_credit: Bill Mason and Shell Film Unit
results.brief_description: Atomisation is defined as the breaking up of liquids into minute drops for efficient burning or economical spreading. Different methods of atomising liquids; scent spray; centrifugal spinning cup plus air blast; pressure jet. Slowed movement illustrations (150X) show how atomisation occurs. Main uses: agricultural and for burning liquid fuel. Various methods of qualitative and quantitative evaluation of spray patterns. Testing jet aircraft atomizers.

results.title: Atomic power and the U.S.
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Atoms for Peace”.
This film examines the United States’ nuclear energy programme for the production of electric power; five types of nuclear reactors designed by U.S. Government laboratories and American industries; nuclear plants operated and financed by private industry. Atomic fuel and technical skills developed by intensive research in the United States are available to other countries through international agreement. No other credits available.

results.title: The Atom and industry
results.creator_credit: Warren P. Everote and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Demonstrates how radio-isotopes are providing new techniques of measurement and quality control in a wide variety of industries. Illustrates the following; radio-active “tagging” or identification of batches of crude oil in the petroleum industry; measurement of wear in petrol engines by using radio-active piston rings; measurement and control of thickness of materials produced in sheet form; testing for flaws in casting.

results.title: The Atom and archaeology
results.creator_credit: Peter Mertens and Handel Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Shows how nuclear and radiation techniques, such as carbon-14 dating, thermoluminescence, atomic fingerprinting, and radiography, have helped archeologists discover new facts about the past. Hitherto impenetrable barriers of time are broken, and new data about ancient civilisations revealed. Pioneer work in progress at leading research centres in the USA is shown.

results.title: Atom and agriculture
results.brief_description: The importance, types and principal uses of radio-active isotopes in agricultural research; radio-active cobalt and calcium used to study growth and hereditary characteristics in plants; radio-active carbon-dioxide used to study the chemistry of food production; radio-sulphur used in the study of wool growth; use of radio-active calcium and phosphorous in research work on egg production. No other credits available.

results.title: Atmosphere and its circulation
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the nature of air, showing its structure, chemical composition, weight and distribution. Its circulation in relation to the Earth, how circulation forms pressure bands and is affected by rotation of the Earth, causing movement or winds; the structure and dynamics of atmosphere are studied with the aid of animated diagrams. No other credits available.
